articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli tanks conducted a second day of probing attacks across Rafah on Wednesday, after Washington said the assault did not amount to a major ground incursion of the southern Gazan city that U.S. officials had told Israel to avoid.
articles.title: Israel sends tanks into Rafah on raids amid Gaza-wide offensive

articles.author: Anait Miridzhanian, Nqobile Dludla
articles.description: South Africans began voting on Wednesday in the most competitive election since the end of apartheid, with opinion polls suggesting the African National Congress (ANC) will lose its parliamentary majority after 30 years in government.
articles.title: South Africans vote in most competitive election since end of apartheid

articles.author: Praveen Menon
articles.description: Families in Yambali village in Papua New Guinea were sleeping peacefully in their beds when a "mountain" of rubble buried them alive in a gigantic landslide, said a U.N. rescue worker at the disaster site and the country's prime minister.
articles.title: 'A mountain fell on them' says rescue worker at PNG landslide site

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Preliminary findings released on Wednesday of an investigation into a Singapore Airlines flight hit by severe turbulence last week showed a rapid change in gravitational force and a 54 metre altitude drop caused injuries.
articles.title: Singapore turbulence flight investigation finds sharp altitude drop caused injuries

articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Emilie Madi
articles.description: The soldiers came before daybreak, singling out the Syrian men without residence permits from the tattered camp in Lebanon's Bekaa Valley. As toddlers wailed around them, Mona, a Syrian refugee in Lebanon for a decade, watched Lebanese troops shuffle her brother onto a truck headed for the Syrian border.
articles.title: Syrians in Lebanon fear unprecedented restrictions, deportations

articles.author: Crispian Balmer, Angelo Amante
articles.description: When Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni took power in 2022, far-right parties across Europe hailed her victory, expecting the fiery new leader in Rome to pursue a nationalist agenda and battle the Brussels bureaucracy.
articles.title: Once ostracised, Italy's Meloni is now centre stage in Europe

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Philippines President Ferdinand Marcos Jr said on Wednesday new rules outlined by China's coast guard that could result in the detention of foreigners in the South China Sea were an escalation and "worrisome".
articles.title: Philippines president calls new China coast guard rules 'worrisome'

articles.author: Panu Wongcha-Um, Panarat Thepgumpanat
articles.description: Thailand's attorney-general will indict former Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra for allegedly insulting the monarchy, an official said on Wednesday, in a setback to a political heavyweight whose loyalists are currently in government.
articles.title: Thailand set to indict former PM Thaksin over royal insult

articles.author: Special Reports
articles.description: After three days of ferocious rains, Edite de Almeida and her husband fled their flooded home in early May and let loose their humble dairy herd on higher ground. Nearby, the waters rose above her head and within a day they were lapping at the roofs of houses.
articles.title: Flood-battered farmers in southern Brazil wade through lost harvests

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian drones have the capability of striking up to 2,500 kilometres (1,553 miles) into Russia, but the capital Moscow has been protected from their strikes, a senior Russian airforce official warned on Wednesday.
articles.title: Ukrainian drones can strike deep into Russia but Moscow is safe, Russian official says
